meanings.definition: To agree to give or allow (something requested or desired)
meanings.sent1: She is granting permission to go to the party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is granting extra time to finish the assignment.
meanings.sent3: After much begging, he finally gave in, granting her request.
meanings.sent4: The sun, granting its warmth to the flowers, helped them bloom beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The king, granting a wish to his loyal subject, made him the happiest man alive.

meanings.definition: Used to introduce a statement that is contrary to what has just been said
meanings.sent1: She wanted to go out; granting, it was already too late.
meanings.sent2: He claimed to be innocent; granting, there were witnesses against him.
meanings.sent3: I thought it was a good idea; granting, I changed my mind after hearing more details.
meanings.sent4: The forecast predicted rain; granting, the sky was clear all day.
meanings.sent5: He said he would help; granting, he never showed up.

meanings.definition: Used to introduce a clause that concedes the truth of something mentioned in the main clause
meanings.sent1: She was tired; granting that she had been working all day.
meanings.sent2: He was upset; granting that his team had lost the game.
meanings.sent3: The cake was delicious; granting that it was a bit too sweet for my taste.
meanings.sent4: The movie was entertaining; granting that the plot was a bit predictable.
meanings.sent5: The dog was cute; granting that it barked a lot.
